answers.answer: Yes it goes in your vagina up towards your cervix. You can also take it orally. I've only ever taken it orally with my other two pregnancies!
Did it work when you took it??
My water broke with both of those pregnancies and I delivered at 37 weeks with both. So I'd say yes.
Wow!! How long did you take it?? Sorry for all the questions but with my last pregnancy, I was in labor for 19 1/2 hours. I wanna try to self induce as much as I can closer to time.
They want to induce me at 37 weeks which is next Monday. I'd like to go naturally before then
what is primrose oil?

Why do they want to induce you so soon?I've been inserting evening primrose oil vaginally since 36 weeks, but not every night. Probably only about a couple times a week. At 37 weeks I was checked and my cervix were very thin and soft. I'm 38 weeks now and I have been using the primrose oil vaginally for the past 4 nights and will continue to do so. I've been feeling sharp pains down there so i'm hoping the primrose oil is helping open me.up.

Because I have preeclampsia and I'm swelling like I did with my first pregnancy. With my first my blood pressure shot up so high they were afraid I was going to stroke. It was very unexpected and scary. However my body didn't do well with pitocin so I want to try to go on my own. My delivery with my first was very fast and scary because of the induction.

Oh. Well do the primrose oil orally as well as vaginally. Get an exercise ball and bounce on it, that will help push baby's head down and put pressure on your cervix. And walk a lot. I don't know exactly how walking helps but that is 1 of the most common ways women try to induce naturally. Good luck! Hopefully these things will work better for you than for me. (:
So I was going to take 500mg in the morning orally 500mg at night orally and put 1,000mg in vaginally at bedtime. Doe that sound about right? And how far in my vagina do I insert the EPO?
My midwife had me do 500mg every other day vaginally starting at 37 weeks.That being said...I wouldn't just start taking it because you read it on the internet. Ask your own doc or midwife.
I do know that most people start off taking 1,000mg orally. My bigger question is how much vaginally?

i started at 1000mg vaginally and now just yesterday i started doing 2000mg vaginally. i haven't been taking it orally. my doctor said taking it orally doesn't do as much good and inserting it vaginally.
How far are you inserting the EPO?
It needs to be as close to your cervix as possible!
Oh good... I can see pain in my near future. My vagina has been extremely sensitive through my entire pregnancy. Someone recommended sex and the thought just made me cringe.
I hate sex this pregnancy as well. My fiance is lucky if he gets it once a month!

I know this may be to much information but I guess we are all women and hopefully it doesn't gross anyone out. I inserted two EPO capsules vaginally but I don't think I got them in far enough. Probably about a middle finger far. When I went to my OB today I am 80% effaced so I shouldn't have that far to go right? Any suggestions for getting them in further? Those bad boys get sort of slippery! Haha...

so is this safe for vbac moms too=)? my doc wont give me any advice on that because he never uses it so he cant tell me anything about it. but i am planning on a vba2c, if some of you ladies dont know that vba2c is its vaginal birth after 2 c-sections.

I would assume so. It's too soften and thin out your cervix. Which is what you will need if you're going to do labor naturally this go around. You're a brave woman!! I'll be having my third c section next month!

question: Hello everyone,I have a question about evening primrose oil. I read that I can insert it as a suppository and this may seem like a weird question but am I inserting it vaginally or rectally. I would assume it would be vaginally so that I can use it to do a perineal massage. Anyone know more?
title: Evening primrose oil
